noun.description: A surface or solid formed by rotating a closed curve, especially a circle, around a line that lies in the same plane but does not intersect it (e.g., like a ring-shaped doughnut).
A large convex molding, typically semicircular in cross section, especially as the lowest part of the base of a column.
A ridge of bone or muscle.

origin: Mid 16th century (in torus (sense 2)): from Latin, literally swelling, bolster, round molding. The other senses date from the 19th century.
